title: Height and Weight
description: We will take two simple measurements to learn about your body. First, we check how tall you are. Then, we check how much you weigh. These steps are quick, safe, and will only take a few minutes. We use your height and weight together to figure out something called Body Mass Index (BMI), which helps us understand your overall health.

procedures.title: Height
procedures.description: We will see how tall you are using a special measuring stick.
details: You will stand up straight without shoes
A bar will gently rest on top of your head
We may measure twice to be sure

procedures.title: Weight
procedures.description: We will check how much you weigh using a scale.
details: You will stand on the scale with both feet
The numbers may change while we write them down
We may check more than once to be accurate

title: Resting Energy Expenditure
summary: Measuring the energy your body needs at rest
description: We want to learn how your body uses energy when you are resting. This is called Resting Energy Expenditure (REE). Knowing your REE helps us understand how many calories your body burns when you are not moving. People with Down syndrome may use a little less energy at rest compared to other adults. We measure this using a clear hood that goes over your head while you relax quietly. The test takes about 20 minutes and is safe and comfortable.

procedures.title: Rest Before the Test
procedures.description: Before we measure, you will rest quietly in a comfortable bed.
details: The room will be quiet and calm
The temperature will be comfortable (not too hot or cold)
You will sit and relax for about 15‚Äì20 minutes

procedures.title: Breathing Under a Clear Hood
procedures.description: We will gently place a clear hood over your head to measure your breathing.
details: The hood feels like a light cover but you can see through it
You will breathe normally while sitting still
We measure how much oxygen your body uses when resting

procedures.title: Finishing Up
procedures.description: When the test is done, we will take off the hood and let you know your results later.
details: The test is complete when your breathing looks steady
It usually takes about 20 minutes of quiet sitting
Your results help us understand your body‚Äôs energy use

title: Activity Energy Expenditure
summary: Measurement of the energy your body needs during activity while monitoring movement with portable accelerometers
description: We want to learn how your body uses energy when you move around. This is called Activity Energy Expenditure (AEE). To measure this, you will wear a comfortable mask that measures your breathing while you do simple everyday activities. You may wear the mask for 6‚Äì8 minutes at a time, and you can take it off between activities if you need to. We will also check your heart rate and use small devices called accelerometers to measure your movement. The whole test takes about 1.5‚Äì2 hours.

procedures.title: Wearing the Breathing Mask
procedures.description: You will wear a soft mask over your nose and mouth so we can measure your breathing.
details: The mask feels like light exercise equipment
You will wear it for 6‚Äì8 minutes during each activity
You can remove it between activities if you need a break

procedures.title: Doing Everyday Activities
procedures.description: You will do simple activities like sitting, walking, or other everyday movements.
details: We will video record the activities to match movement with breathing
Each activity lasts about 6‚Äì8 minutes
The test feels like practicing regular daily tasks

procedures.title: Heart Rate Strap
procedures.description: We will measure your heart rate with a strap under your shirt.
details: The strap fits around your chest like a belt
It is worn under your shirt, just below your chest
You won‚Äôt feel anything while it measures your heartbeat

procedures.title: Wearing Accelerometers
procedures.description: Small devices will measure how much you move.
details: One will be worn on your hip
Two more will be worn like watches on your wrists
They are light and comfortable

title: Cognitive Testing
description: We will ask you to answer questions and complete short activities that help us learn about your memory, language, movement, and thinking skills. You will work one-on-one with a study team member for about 2‚Äì3 hours. Some people may do fewer activities if they get tired or if it becomes difficult. These activities are safe, and you can take breaks when needed.
summary: Answer questions and do short activities about memory, language, movement, and thinking with a team member.

procedures.title: Memory & Attention
procedures.description: Activities that help us learn how well you remember things and stay focused.
details: You may be asked to remember words, pictures, or personal information
You might practice paying attention to certain items and ignoring others
Some tasks are like games where you match or recall items

procedures.title: Language Skills
procedures.description: Activities that check how you understand and use words.
details: You may be asked to name pictures or objects
You might think of as many words as you can in a certain category
You may answer questions about language or repeat phrases

procedures.title: Movement & Coordination
procedures.description: Simple tasks to see how you use your hands and body.
details: You may copy hand movements or place small pegs into holes
You may walk a short distance while we watch your steps
You may copy drawings or build shapes with blocks

procedures.title: Problem Solving & Thinking
procedures.description: Activities that test how you solve problems and think through challenges.
details: You may be asked to recreate block patterns
You may circle pictures on a page with both targets and distractors
Some activities measure how quickly and carefully you solve puzzles

title: Study Partner Questions
description: We will ask your study partner questions about your health, behavior, and daily life. This helps us understand more about how you are doing. Sometimes we may also look at your medical records or ask other people who know you, like caregivers or staff. The questions take about 2 hours, but your study partner will answer most of them.
summary: Your study partner will answer questions about your health, behavior, and daily life. It takes about 2 hours.

procedures.title: Health & Daily Life
procedures.description: Your partner will answer questions about your medical history and daily activities.
details: Questions about health, medical events, and life changes
Questions about daily skills like communication and living activities
Some questions may be answered on paper or a tablet

procedures.title: Memory & Thinking
procedures.description: Your partner will be asked about your memory and thinking skills.
details: Short-term and long-term memory
Attention and orientation (time, place, personal info)
Any changes noticed over time

procedures.title: Feelings & Behavior
procedures.description: Your partner will be asked about your mood, feelings, and behaviors.
details: Questions about sadness, anxiety, or happiness
Questions about sleep, eating, or changes in interest
Questions about challenging behaviors like aggression or withdrawal

procedures.title: Stress & Mental Health
procedures.description: Your partner will answer questions about stress and mental health concerns.
details: Events that may have caused stress in the past year
Screening for concerns like depression, paranoia, or anxiety
Helps us understand your overall well-being

title: Medical History, Physical and Neurological Exam
description: We will get information about your past medical history, including medications you may be taking. A trained clinician will complete a physical and neurological exam, much like the exam you might have during a regular trip to your doctor‚Äôs office. This exam will also include screening for conditions that might make you ineligible for certain procedures like MRIs or PET scans. We will also measure your height and weight as part of this assessment.
summary: We will collect your medical history, medications, and complete a physical and neurological exam.

procedures.title: Medical History
procedures.description: We will ask about your past health, medications, and any relevant medical events.
details: Questions about medications you take regularly
Information from your medical chart or records if available
Updates may also be provided by your study partner

procedures.title: Physical Examination
procedures.description: A trained clinician will check your body and overall health.
details: Exam similar to a routine doctor visit
Checks overall physical health and screens for conditions that might affect participation in some tests
Includes basic neurological checks

procedures.title: Height & Weight
procedures.description: We will measure your height and weight to help understand your body and calculate BMI.
details: You will stand up straight without shoes for height measurement
You will step on a scale to measure weight
Measurements may be repeated for accuracy

title: Blood Draw
description: A trained person will take a small amount of blood from your arm, just like at a doctor‚Äôs office. This might be done with a needle or through a small tube (IV) if you are also having a PET scan. The blood will be used to learn about your genes and proteins that might affect risk for Alzheimer‚Äôs disease. Some samples will be stored for future research to help scientists develop new tests and treatments. The amount of blood is small and safe.
summary: A trained person will take a small blood sample to study genes and proteins. Some samples will be stored for future research.

procedures.title: Preparing for the Blood Draw
procedures.description: A trained person will prepare your arm for the blood draw.
details: Your arm will be cleaned before the needle or IV is inserted
You will sit or lie comfortably during the procedure
You can take deep breaths to stay relaxed

procedures.title: Collecting the Blood
procedures.description: A small amount of blood will be collected safely.
details: The blood may be taken through a needle or IV if you are having a PET scan
The total amount is small (up to 4 tablespoons or 53 ml)
This is safe and will not affect your health

procedures.title: Research and Future Use
procedures.description: Your blood will be used to study genes, proteins, and other factors, and some will be stored for future research.
details: Some blood may confirm Down syndrome if past tests are unavailable
Samples help scientists understand Alzheimer‚Äôs disease and other conditions
All samples are coded to protect your privacy
Stored samples may be shared with researchers but never include information that can identify you

title: MRI Scan
description: An MRI scan is used to take pictures of your brain. It uses a strong magnet and radio waves and does not involve radiation, blood samples, or injections. You will be asked to remove all jewelry and metal objects before the scan. You will lie on a narrow table with ear plugs or headphones and slide into the MRI machine. During the scan, you need to stay very still and will hear loud noises. Study staff can see and talk to you throughout the scan, and you can ask them to stop at any time. The scan takes about 60 minutes. If the MRI shows something important for your health, your doctor will be informed with your permission.
summary: Lie still in an MRI to take pictures of your brain. It is safe, has no radiation, and staff can communicate with you. The scan takes about 60 minutes.

procedures.title: Preparing for the MRI
procedures.description: You will need to remove all jewelry and metal objects before entering the MRI room.
details: This keeps you safe because the MRI uses a strong magnet
A staff person will check for any metal in your clothes or accessories
You will also be asked a few questions about your health and past work

procedures.title: During the MRI Scan
procedures.description: You will lie on a narrow table that slides into the MRI machine.
details: You will wear ear plugs or headphones for the loud noises
You need to lie very still so the pictures are clear
Staff can see you and talk to you throughout the scan
You can ask the scan to stop at any time

procedures.title: After the MRI
procedures.description: After the scan, you can get up and relax.
details: If the MRI shows anything important for your health, your doctor will be informed with your permission
The scan itself is safe and for research purposes

title: PET Scan
description: A PET scan takes pictures of your brain using a special dye (radiotracer) to see certain proteins linked to Alzheimer‚Äôs disease. A small plastic tube (IV) will be placed in your arm to give the dye. You will need to lie still while the scan takes pictures. You can ask the staff to stop at any time. Different PET scans may be done depending on your study visit, including amyloid, tau, and FDG scans. The whole process may take 1¬Ω to 3 hours.
summary: A PET scan takes pictures of your brain using a small dye. You lie still, and staff can stop the scan if needed. The scan takes 1¬Ω‚Äì3 hours.

procedures.title: Preparing for the PET Scan
procedures.description: A staff member will place a small plastic tube (IV) in your arm to give the radiotracer.
details: The IV is placed using a needle, similar to a blood draw
If other procedures are done the same day, the IV may only be placed once
You may need to fast for some scans like FDG PET

procedures.title: Waiting for the Radiotracer
procedures.description: After the dye is given, you will wait while it travels to your brain.
details: Amyloid PET: wait 40‚Äì50 minutes
Tau PET: wait 60‚Äì90 minutes
FDG PET: wait about 25 minutes after blood sugar check

procedures.title: During the PET Scan
procedures.description: You will lie on a table while the PET scanner takes pictures of your brain.
details: Your head will be supported to keep you from moving
You need to lie very still
You can tell staff to stop at any time

procedures.title: After the PET Scan
procedures.description: Once the scan is finished, you can get up and relax.
details: The scan is for research purposes only
If something important for your health is found, your doctor will be informed with your permission
The total visit time depends on the type of PET scan and waiting time
